title: Intel expands its Oregon factory with $3 billion investment as it aims to accelerate chip development
content:
Intel has been on a roll when it comes to expanding and growing the scope of its operations. Today, Intel inaugurated the latest expansion of its Oregon factory called D1X, and announced a new name for it – it’s now known as Gordon Moore Park. The investment cost over $3 billion and it’s been in

The post Intel expands its Oregon factory with $3 billion investment as it aims to accelerate chip development appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Intel has inaugurated the latest expansion of its Oregon factory, which is now known as Gordon Moore Park, an investment worth $3 billion.
